Lack enough support: The claim of Indonesia giving citizens free tickets to return home after the coronavirus outbreak lacks sufficient evidence or verification.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Indonesia is providing free tickets to its citizens without any official confirmation or announcement.
Contradict fact: The Indonesian Foreign Ministry and PT Angkasa Pura have both dismissed the claim as a hoax, contradicting the information provided in the post.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the offer of free tickets by stating that there are only 1,000 available and that those who report fast will return home free of charge.
Understate: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim understates any information.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim could be a result of misinformation or a deliberate attempt to deceive people for fraudulent purposes.
Falters at times: There is no indication that the claim falters at any point.
